result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Westrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees while on supervision on 14CF4058 and 15CF4218 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E Westrich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing JULY 21, 2017 received and filed. (32 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to.

Defendant Michael E Westrich in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Michael E Westrich in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  JEFFREY A., BRIAN C., JUSTIN D.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIXTY (60) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for SIXTY (60) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON SUPERVISION ON 14CF4058 and 15CF4218 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael E Westrich in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Michael E Westrich in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  State moved to REVOKE the DTC/DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  COURT CONTINUED REMAND.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael E Westrich in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE IV

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract.  No sanctions are imposed.  Defendant to compose letter per instruction of the Court.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  No points are awarded.  Sobriety date to be reset.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 29, 2017 at 09:30 am.

DTC - PHASE I

Defense Counsel was to WITHDRAW today.  Defendant WAIVED the appearance of Attorney Meetz.  Attorney Patterson (on behalf of the Public Defender's Office) stated that this matter WILL BE accepted by the OSPD.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Turnover to JusticePoint for Placement.  Upon Placement,  Bail to revert to $250.00 PR Bond.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Michael E Westrich in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Michael E Westrich in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to be assessed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant claimed he was out-of town and unable to attend today's hearing.  Defendant FURTHER claimed to be unaware of the date.  After examination on the Record,  Court discovered Defendant IS in Milwaukee and WAS aware of today's date.  Court ordered Defendant in to Court FORTHWITH.  sdg
